The overarching purpose of the C3 Project is to improve health and well-being outcomes for orphans and vulnerable children (OVC) affected by HIV and AIDS and other adversities. C3 seeks to support systems and structures at country and regional levels to help them promote evidence-based interventions to protect against risk, interrupt cycles of vulnerability, and build pathways to resilience leading to an AIDS Free Generation and contributing to overall improvements in quality of life and productivity in vulnerable children and their families. Efforts to strengthen child welfare and protection systems will be accomplished through the following objectives: Objective 1: To increase the availability and use of evidence through surveillance and research to inform strategic child welfare and protection programming for children affected by AIDS and other adversities Objective 2: To support countries to scale up evidence-based child welfare and protection programming for Children Affected by AIDS and other Adversities from the household and community levels to the national level Objective 3: To create an enabling environment, focused on local capacity and ownership, that is conducive to sustainable and quality child welfare and protection programming for children affected by AIDS and other adversities. Built on CapacityPlus investments, this mechanism will provide technical assistance to Ministry of Social Affairs at the central level and drive the research agenda on 3 provinces (Katanga, Kinshasa and Orientale) while transfering skills to local institutions.
